title: PETA sues over Mass. wiretap laws, saying they impede animal cruelty investigations
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: PETA is challenging Massachusetts' wiretap laws, claiming they hinder animal cruelty investigations by preventing secret recordings.
The lawsuit filed in federal court names Attorney General Andrea Campbell and DA Anthony Gulluni as defendants.
Massachusetts requires all-party consent for recordings, unlike 39 states where only one party's consent is needed.

title: Ben Affleck teases Dunkin’ Super Bowl commercial with stars of ‘Seinfeld,’ ‘Friends’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in the 2026 Dunkin' Super Bowl ad with '90s TV stars Jennifer Aniston, Jason Alexander, and Matt LeBlanc.
The commercial teaser features Affleck with a VHS tape labeled 'Network Pilot '95 v3,' described as 'monstah cringe.'
This marks the fourth consecutive year of Dunkin' Super Bowl commercials produced by Affleck and Artists Equity.

title: All the new movies and TV shows streaming in February
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Romantic films like 'You’ve Got Mail' and 'Notting Hill' are streaming for Valentine’s Day on Netflix and Peacock.
Black History Month showcases films by Spike Lee and Ava DuVernay, streaming Selma and Malcolm X.
2025 films debut on streaming including Jennifer Lopez's 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' on Hulu Feb. 27.

title: Here’s how much a gig worker makes in Somerville
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A 52-year-old gig worker in Somerville makes $22,000 annually after business expenses.
The worker manages hybrid jobs including dog walking, consulting, and ADHD coaching to sustain a simple lifestyle.
She maintains a low-cost living by renting a large house, subletting rooms, and living frugally with three roommates.

title: More Harvard connections to Epstein revealed in newly released documents
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Harvard Professor Lisa Randall continued contact with Jeffrey Epstein after his 2008 conviction, including emails and a private jet flight.
Harvard Hillel leaders solicited donations from Epstein post-conviction, despite his guilty plea for soliciting prostitution from a minor.
Harvard received $9 million from Epstein, sparking scrutiny of its past connections with the disgraced financier.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about ‘the potential for record-breaking cold’ this weekend
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Temperatures in Boston are expected to plummet with wind chills reaching -15° to -25° by Sunday morning.
Meteorologists warn of a strong Arctic air surge this weekend, potentially breaking record-low temperatures.
Light snow is forecasted for Friday night into Saturday, followed by dangerously low wind chills for Sunday.

title: WBZ’s Steve Burton shared a ‘humbling moment’ during Super Bowl week, and people loved it
author: John Waller
bullets: WBZ-TV's Steve Burton shares a 'humbling moment' on X after seeing daughter Veronica on a Golden State Valkyries billboard.
Veronica Burton, WNBA player for Valkyries, was No. 7 pick in 2002 draft and won Most Improved Player last season.
A post about Burton being recognized as 'Veronica's dad' in Bay Area has received over 200 replies and 350 reposts.

title: Scituate’s Mike Macdonald has ‘evolved’ from his Red Sox fandom. He’s scheming to take down the Patriots.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald, a Massachusetts native, will face the Patriots in the Super Bowl this Sunday.
Macdonald, a former Patriots fan, now leads Seahawks with a strong defense known for allowing fewest points in season.
Macdonald, who once dreamed of managing the Red Sox, shifted his MLB allegiance to support the Seattle Mariners.

title: ‘Jeopardy!’ featured a Massachusetts colleges category. Can you run the table?
author: John Waller
bullets: 'Jeopardy!' featured a category on Massachusetts colleges in its 'Tournament of Champions' episode.
The category included clues about Smith College, Amherst, Brandeis, Northeastern, and Mount Holyoke.
Contestants did not answer the $1,200 clue about Brandeis, despite its unique focus on Massachusetts institutions.

title: ‘May the best team win’: Tom Brady’s evasive answer regarding his Super Bowl LX rooting interest
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady expressed a neutral stance regarding the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, stating he doesn't 'have a dog in the fight.'
Brady acknowledged the Patriots' achievements under new leadership and the exciting time for New England fans.
Brady dismissed speculation he might root against the Patriots to distinguish his legacy from his Super Bowl successes.
